N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 551.8 - Application for prior approval review-project scope

State Regulations
(a) Applicants proposing projects under
EZ-PAR or Comprehensive PAR review categories shall submit a letter of intent, on prescribed forms, to the Office of Mental Health and the local governmental
unit(s), stating that the agency expects to submit an application for a PAR
within the next 30-90 period. Submission of a letter of intent is not expected
for projects deemed as an emergency. (b) Applicants proposing projects shall
submit applications in a form and format prescribed by the Office of Mental

Health. Such form and format shall include instructions for submission of the
application, and shall facilitate submission in either paper or electronic
format. (c) The application shall
include information as specified by the Office of Mental Health which is
relevant to the scope of the proposed project to enable review in accordance
with the requirements of this Part. (d) Projects that are subject to prior
approval by the Department of Health under the Public Health Law shall submit
an application as prescribed by the Department of Health. The Office of Mental

Health reserves the right to request additional information from such
applicants to enable conformance with the requirements of this Part. (1)

The Department of Health will request
review of such applications by the Office of Mental Health prior to a final
decision on the application. The Office of Mental Health will review these
applications in accordance with the requirements of this Part before advising
the Department of Health of the findings and recommendations of the
review. (2)

To assure timely notice
to the Office of Mental Health, the applicant shall submit a copy of the
application to the Office of Mental Health, as well as the appropriate local
governmental unit(s), at the time of submission of the application to the

Department of Health. (3)

If the

Department of Health does not require submission of an application for a
project as described in this Part, the Office of Mental Health shall require
submission of an application to the Office of Mental Health for prior approval
review under this Part. (e) An applicant who has a current operating
certificate with a duration of less than 12 months, or who has had an operating
certificate with a duration of less than 12 months within two years of filing
the application, must demonstrate the ability to comply with regulatory
requirements in currently licensed programs prior to the Office of Mental

Health approving such application. Notes
